Thanks to everyone for the replies.

I've only been playing around with NEAT for a couple of days and I've 
staill got a lot to learn.  I've picked up a few idea and I'll try to 
put them to the test today.

Thanks Colin for the update.  I'll modify my example to provide inputs 
between 0 and 1 as well as the parameter changes you suggested, and 
I'll let you know how it goes.

Regards
Chris.
